org.fujion.plotly.layout

Class RadialAxisOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.fujion.ancillary.Options
      • org.fujion.plotly.layout.AxisOptions
        • org.fujion.plotly.layout.RadialAxisOptions
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    OptionMap.IOptionMapConverter, IClientTransform

    public class RadialAxisOptions
extends AxisOptions
    Layout options for polar angular axis.

    • Field Detail

      • angle

        @Option
public Integer angle
        The angle (in degrees) from which the radial axis is drawn. Note that by default, radial axis line on the theta=0 line corresponds to a line pointing right (like what mathematicians prefer).

        Default: the first "polar.sector" angle.

      • side

        @Option
public PolarDirectionEnum side
        Determines on which side of radial axis line the tick and tick labels appear.

        Default: CLOCKWISE

      • hoverformat

        @Option
public String hoverformat
        The hover text formatting rule using d3 formatting mini-languages which are very similar to those in Python. For numbers, see: https://github.com/d3/d3-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format And for dates see: https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format We add one item to d3's date formatter: "%{n}f" for fractional seconds with n digits. For example, "2016-10-13 09:15:23.456" with tickformat "%H~%M~%S.%2f" would display "09~15~23.46"

      • ticks

        @Option
public TicksEnum ticks
        Determines whether and where ticks are drawn.

      • ticklen

        @Option
public Integer ticklen
        The tick length (in px).

        Constraints: ≥0

        Length: 5

      • tickwidth

        @Option
public Integer tickwidth
        The tick width (in px).

        Constraints: ≥0

        Default: 1

      • tickcolor

        @Option
public String tickcolor
        The tick color;

        Default: "#444"

      • layer

        @Option
public LayerEnum layer
        The layer on which this axis is displayed. Useful when used together with scatter-like traces with "cliponaxis" set to "false" to show markers and/or text nodes above this axis.

      • calendar

        @Option
public CalendarTypeEnum calendar
        The calendar system to use for "range" and "tick0" if this is a date axis. This does not set the calendar for interpreting data on this axis, that's specified in the trace or via the global "layout.calendar"

      • visible

        @Option
public Boolean visible

    • Constructor Detail

      • RadialAxisOptions

        public RadialAxisOptions()
